question: Who were wanderers?
answer1: Manawyddan the prince and his friend Pryderi

question: Why were Manawyddan the prince and his friend Pryderi wanderers?
answer1: The brother of Manawyddan had been slain, and his throne taken from him.

question: How did Manawyddan feel after his brother was slain?
answer1: very sorrowful

question: Why wasn't Pryderi very sorrowful like Manawyddan?
answer1: He knew a way out of his trouble.

question: Who did Pryderi want Manawyddan to be married to?
answer1: his mother Rhiannon

question: What did Rhiannon and Kieva, wife of Pryderi do after they heard the two men were coming?
answer1: made haste to prepare a feast for them

question: What did Rhiannon do after Manawyddan proposed to her?
answer1: consented

question: What happened after Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi sat out in a green place?
answer1: Suddenly the crash of thunder struck loudly on their ears, and a wall of mist fell between them.

question: How did Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi feel when they were separated from each other?
answer1: scared
answer2: afraid

question: What happened after light shone on Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi again?
answer1: They were the only ones in the green place.
answer2: Everything disappeared from the green place.

question: How did Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi feel after everything disappeared?
answer1: concerned
answer2: confused

question: What did Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi do for a year?
answer1: fed on the meat that Manawyddan and Pryderi killed out hunting, and the honey of the bees that sucked the mountain heather

question: Why did Manawyddan want to go to England?
answer1: learn some trade by which they may live

question: What did the four people make after they went to England?
answer1: saddles

question: Why did saddlers band together to slay Manawyddan and his companions?
answer1: The townsfolk only bought from Manawyddan and his companions.
answer2: The saddlers did not make money after Manawyddan and his companions sold their saddles.

question: Why didn't Pryderi fight the saddlers?
answer1: The counsels of Manawyddan prevailed, and they moved by night to another city.

question: What craft did Manawyddan want to follow next?
answer1: make shields

question: What will happen after the four people decide to make shields?
answer1: The shield-makers will band together as the saddlers had done, and resolve to slay them.

question: Why did Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi leave to go to another town?
answer1: The shield-makers wanted to slay them.
answer2: They needed to leave before the shield-makers attacked them.

question: What craft did Manawyddan want to follow next after his group decided to not make shields anymore?
answer1: make shoes

question: Why did Manawyddan want to make shoes?
answer1: There were not any among the shoemakers bold enough to fight them.

question: What did Manawyddan seek the town for?
answer1: the best leather, and for a goldsmith

question: What was Manawyddan known as?
answer1: The Maker of Gold Shoes

question: Where did Manawyddan want to go to after craftsmen banded together to slay his group?
answer1: Dyved

question: What did Rhiannon, Manawyddan, Kieva and Pryderi do after they came to their lands at Narberth?
answer1: gathered their dogs round them, and hunted for a year as before

question: Why were the dogs scared when they came to a small bush?
answer1: They saw a boar.
answer2: They met a boar.

question: Where did the boar run to?
answer1: the castle

question: What did Pryderi want to do after the dogs and boars went into the castle?
answer1: go into the castle and get tidings of the dogs

question: How did Pryderi feel after his dogs chased after the boar?
answer1: concerned
answer2: worried

question: Why did Pryderi forget about his dogs?
answer1: He saw a golden bowl.
answer2: He was pleased by the golden bowl.

question: What happened after Pryderi took hold of the golden bowl?
answer1: His hands stuck to the bowl, and his feet to the marble slab, and despair took possession of him.

question: How did Pryderi feel after he was trapped?
answer1: scared
answer2: terrified

question: What did Rhiannon do after she saw Pryderi?
answer1: hastened towards him

question: What happened after thunder was heard and a veil of darkness descended upon them?
answer1: The castle vanished and they with it.

question: How did Kieva and Manawyddan feel after their partners disappeared?
answer1: sad
answer2: upset

question: Why did Kieva and Manawyddan move to England?
answer1: It was easier for us to live there.

question: What craft did Manawyddan decide to follow after Rhiannon and Pryderi disappeared?
answer1: make shoes

question: What did Manawyddan do after the shoemakers banded together in anger to kill him?
answer1: left the town one night and proceeded to Narberth, taking with him a sheaf of wheat, which he sowed in three plots of ground

question: Why were Manawyddan's corn and wheat disappearing?
answer1: Mice took his crops.
answer2: Mice stole his crops.

question: What happened after Manawyddan went to reap the wheat?
answer1: found nothing but the bare straw

question: Why did Manawyddan hide himself and wait?
answer1: He wanted to see who took his crops.
answer2: He needed to see who was taking his corn and wheat.

question: What did Manawyddan see at midnight?
answer1: a mighty host of mice

question: What did Manawyddan do after he saw one lingering mouse?
answer1: seized it by the tail, and put it in his glove, and tied a piece of string across the opening of the glove

question: What did Manawyddan show Kieva?
answer1: how fields of corn had been wasted

question: What did Kieva tell Manawyddan to do with the mouse?
answer1: Do not meddle with it, but let it go.

question: How did Manawyddan feel after he saw the mice eating his crops?
answer1: angry
answer2: mad

question: Who did Manawyddan see coming towards him?
answer1: a scholar

question: How many years has it been since Manawyddan saw a man or beast in this place?
answer1: seven years

question: How were the scholar and Kieva similar?
answer1: They both wanted Manawyddan to let go of the mouse.
answer2: They both did not want Manawyddan to hurt the mouse.

question: What did the priest want to do after he saw the mouse?
answer1: purchase its freedom

question: How were the priest and scholar similar?
answer1: They both wanted to buy the mouse's freedom.
answer2: They both offered money to save the mouse.

question: Who had a great following and horses bearing huge packs?
answer1: a bishop

question: Why did the bishop offer money to Manawyddan?
answer1: He wanted to save the mouse.
answer2: He wanted to set the mouse free.

question: What did the bishop offer to Manawyddan after he refused the money?
answer1: all the horses and the seven loads of baggage

question: What did Manawyddan want the bishop to do?
answer1: The spell must be taken off Rhiannon and Pryderi.
answer2: The charm that has been cast over all his lands must be taken off.

question: Why did the bishop want to save the mouse?
answer1: She was his wife.

question: Why did the bishop decide to break the spell he casted?
answer1: Manawyddan took his wife.
answer2: Manawyddan was about to kill his wife.

question: Why didn't Manawyddan immediately set the bishop's wife free?
answer1: He wanted the bishop to fulfill his promises first.
answer2: He wanted to make sure the bishop brought back Pryderi and Rhiannon.

question: How did Manawyddan feel after he saw Pryderi and Rhiannon again?
answer1: happy
answer2: excited

question: What did Manawyddan see after the bishop released the spell?
answer1: saw growing in the fields, and cows and sheep grazing on the hill-side, and huts for the people to dwell in
